072/**
073 * Represents a request to a remote REST resource.
074 *
075 * <p>
076 * Instances of this class are created by the various creator methods on the {@link RestClient} class.
077 *
078 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
079 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not thread safe.
080 * </ul>
081 *
082 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
083 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauRestClientBasics">juneau-rest-client Basics</a>
084 * </ul>
085 */
086@FluentSetters
087public class RestRequest extends BeanSession implements HttpUriRequest, Configurable, AutoCloseable {
088
089   private static final ContentType TEXT_PLAIN = ContentType.TEXT_PLAIN;
090
091   final RestClient client;                               // The client that created this call.
092   private final HttpRequestBase request;                 // The request.
093   private RestResponse response;                         // The response.
094   List<RestCallInterceptor> interceptors = list();   // Used for intercepting and altering requests.
095
096   private HeaderList headerData;
097   private PartList queryData, formData, pathData;
098
099   private boolean ignoreErrors, suppressLogging;
100
101   private Object content;
102   private Serializer serializer;
103   private Parser parser;
104   private HttpPartSchema contentSchema;
105   private URIBuilder uriBuilder;
106   private Predicate<Integer> errorCodes;
107   private HttpHost target;
108   private HttpContext context;
109   private List<Class<? extends Throwable>> rethrow;
110   private HttpPartSerializerSession partSerializerSession;
111
112   private final Map<HttpPartSerializer,HttpPartSerializerSession> partSerializerSessions = new IdentityHashMap<>();
113
114   /**
115    * Constructs a REST call with the specified method name.
116    *
117    * @param client The client that created this request.
118    * @param uri The target URI.
119    * @param method The HTTP method name (uppercase).
120    * @param hasBody Whether this method has a body.
121    * @throws RestCallException If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
122    */
123   protected RestRequest(RestClient client, URI uri, String method, boolean hasBody) throws RestCallException {
124      super(client.getBeanContext().createSession());
125      this.client = client;
126      this.request = createInnerRequest(method, uri, hasBody);
127      this.errorCodes = client.errorCodes;
128      this.uriBuilder = new URIBuilder(request.getURI());
129      this.ignoreErrors = client.ignoreErrors;
130      this.headerData = client.createHeaderData();
131      this.queryData = client.createQueryData();
132      this.formData = client.createFormData();
133      this.pathData = client.createPathData();
134   }
135
136   /**
137    * Constructs the {@link HttpRequestBase} object that ends up being passed to the client execute method.
138    *
139    * <p>
140    * Subclasses can override this method to create their own request base objects.
141    *
142    * @param method The HTTP method.
143    * @param uri The HTTP URI.
144    * @param hasBody Whether the HTTP request has a body.
145    * @return A new {@link HttpRequestBase} object.
146    */
147   protected HttpRequestBase createInnerRequest(String method, URI uri, boolean hasBody) {
148      HttpRequestBase req = hasBody ? new BasicHttpEntityRequestBase(this, method) : new BasicHttpRequestBase(this, method);
149      req.setURI(uri);
150      return req;
151   }
152
153
154   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
155   // Configuration
156   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
157
158   /**
159    * Convenience method for specifying JSON as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
160    *
161    * <p>
162    * {@link JsonSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
163    *    <ul>
164    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
165    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
166    *    </ul>
167    * <p>
168    *    {@link JsonParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
169    *    <ul>
170    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
171    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
172    *    </ul>
173    * <p>
174    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"application/json"</js> unless overridden
175    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
176    * <p>
177    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"application/json"</js> unless overridden
178    *       {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
179    * <p>
180    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(JsonSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(JsonParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
181    *
182    * @return This object.
183    */
184   @FluentSetter
185   public RestRequest json() {
186      return serializer(JsonSerializer.class).parser(JsonParser.class);
187   }
188
189   /**
190    * Convenience method for specifying Simplified JSON as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
191    *
192    * <p>
193    * Simplified JSON is typically useful for automated tests because you can do simple string comparison of results
194    * without having to escape lots of quotes.
195    *
196    * <p>
197    *    {@link Json5Serializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
198    *    <ul>
199    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
200    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
201    *    </ul>
202    * <p>
203    *    {@link Json5Parser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
204    *    <ul>
205    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
206    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
207    *    </ul>
208    * <p>
209    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"application/json"</js> unless overridden
210    *       by {@link #header(String,Object)} or {@link #accept(String)}, or per-request via {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
211    * <p>
212    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"application/json+simple"</js> unless overridden
213    *       by {@link #header(String,Object)} or {@link #contentType(String)}, or per-request via {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
214    * <p>
215    *    Can be combined with other marshaller setters such as {@link #xml()} to provide support for multiple languages.
216    *    <ul>
217    *       <li>When multiple languages are supported, the <c>Accept</c> and <c>Content-Type</c> headers control which marshallers are used, or uses the
218    *       last-enabled language if the headers are not set.
219    *    </ul>
220    * <p>
221    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(Json5Serializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(Json5Parser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
222    *
223    * @return This object.
224    */
225   @FluentSetter
226   public RestRequest json5() {
227      return serializer(Json5Serializer.class).parser(Json5Parser.class);
228   }
229
230   /**
231    * Convenience method for specifying XML as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
232    *
233    * <p>
234    * {@link XmlSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
235    *    <ul>
236    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
237    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
238    *    </ul>
239    * <p>
240    *    {@link XmlParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
241    *    <ul>
242    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
243    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
244    *    </ul>
245    * <p>
246    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/xml"</js> unless overridden
247    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
248    * <p>
249    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/xml"</js> unless overridden
250    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
251    * <p>
252    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(XmlSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(XmlParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
253    *
254    * @return This object.
255    */
256   @FluentSetter
257   public RestRequest xml() {
258      return serializer(XmlSerializer.class).parser(XmlParser.class);
259   }

261   /**
262    * Convenience method for specifying HTML as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
263    *
264    * <p>
265    * POJOs are converted to HTML without any sort of doc wrappers.
266    *
267    * <p>
268    *    {@link HtmlSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
269    *    <ul>
270    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
271    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
272    *    </ul>
273    * <p>
274    *    {@link HtmlParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
275    *    <ul>
276    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
277    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
278    *    </ul>
279    * <p>
280    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/html"</js> unless overridden
281    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
282    * <p>
283    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/html"</js> unless overridden
284    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
285    * <p>
286    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(HtmlSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(HtmlParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
287    *
288    * @return This object.
289    */
290   @FluentSetter
291   public RestRequest html() {
292      return serializer(HtmlSerializer.class).parser(HtmlParser.class);
293   }

305    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
306    *    </ul>
307    * <p>
308    *    {@link HtmlParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
309    *    <ul>
310    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
311    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
312    *    </ul>
313    * <p>
314    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/html"</js> unless overridden
315    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
316    * <p>
317    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/html"</js> unless overridden
318    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.

329   /**
330    * Convenience method for specifying Stripped HTML DOC as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
331    *
332    * <p>
333    * Same as {@link #htmlDoc()} but without the header and body tags and page title and description.
334    *
335    * <p>
336    *    {@link HtmlStrippedDocSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
337    *    <ul>
338    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
339    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
340    *    </ul>
341    * <p>
342    *    {@link HtmlParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
343    *    <ul>
344    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
345    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
346    *    </ul>
347    * <p>
348    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/html+stripped"</js> unless overridden
349    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
350    * <p>
351    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/html+stripped"</js> unless overridden
352    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
353    * <p>
354    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(HtmlStrippedDocSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(HtmlParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
355    *
356    * @return This object.
357    */
358   @FluentSetter
359   public RestRequest htmlStrippedDoc() {
360      return serializer(HtmlStrippedDocSerializer.class).parser(HtmlParser.class);
361   }

363   /**
364    * Convenience method for specifying Plain Text as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
365    *
366    * <p>
367    * Plain text marshalling typically only works on simple POJOs that can be converted to and from strings using
368    * swaps, swap methods, etc...
369    *
370    * <p>
371    *    {@link PlainTextSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
372    *    <ul>
373    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
374    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
375    *    </ul>
376    * <p>
377    *    {@link PlainTextParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
378    *    <ul>
379    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
380    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
381    *    </ul>
382    * <p>
383    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/plain"</js> unless overridden
384    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
385    * <p>
386    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/plain"</js> unless overridden
387    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
388    * <p>
389    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(PlainTextSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(PlainTextParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
390    *
391    * @return This object.
392    */
393   @FluentSetter
394   public RestRequest plainText() {
395      return serializer(PlainTextSerializer.class).parser(PlainTextParser.class);
396   }

398   /**
399    * Convenience method for specifying MessagePack as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
400    *
401    * <p>
402    * MessagePack is a binary equivalent to JSON that takes up considerably less space than JSON.
403    *
404    * <p>
405    *    {@link MsgPackSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
406    *    <ul>
407    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
408    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
409    *    </ul>
410    * <p>
411    *    {@link MsgPackParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
412    *    <ul>
413    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
414    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
415    *    </ul>
416    * <p>
417    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"octal/msgpack"</js> unless overridden
418    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
419    * <p>
420    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"octal/msgpack"</js> unless overridden
421    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
422    * <p>
423    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(MsgPackSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(MsgPackParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
424    *
425    * @return This object.
426    */
427   @FluentSetter
428   public RestRequest msgPack() {
429      return serializer(MsgPackSerializer.class).parser(MsgPackParser.class);
430   }

432   /**
433    * Convenience method for specifying UON as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
434    *
435    * <p>
436    * UON is Url-Encoding Object notation that is equivalent to JSON but suitable for transmission as URL-encoded
437    * query and form post values.
438    *
439    * <p>
440    *    {@link UonSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
441    *    <ul>
442    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
443    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
444    *    </ul>
445    * <p>
446    *    {@link UonParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
447    *    <ul>
448    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
449    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
450    *    </ul>
451    * <p>
452    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/uon"</js> unless overridden
453    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
454    * <p>
455    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/uon"</js> unless overridden
456    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
457    * <p>
458    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(UonSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(UonParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
459    *
460    * @return This object.
461    */
462   @FluentSetter
463   public RestRequest uon() {
464      return serializer(UonSerializer.class).parser(UonParser.class);
465   }
466
467   /**
468    * Convenience method for specifying URL-Encoding as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
469    *
470    * <p>
471    *    {@link UrlEncodingSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
472    *    <ul>
473    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
474    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
475    *       <li>This serializer is NOT used when using the {@link RestRequest#formData(String, Object)} (and related) methods for constructing
476    *          the request body.  Instead, the part serializer specified via {@link RestClient.Builder#partSerializer(Class)} is used.
477    *    </ul>
478    * <p>
479    *    {@link UrlEncodingParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
480    *    <ul>
481    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
482    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
483    *    </ul>
484    * <p>
485    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js> unless overridden
486    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
487    * <p>
488    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js> unless overridden
489    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
490    * <p>
491    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(UrlEncodingSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(UrlEncodingParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
492    *
493    * @return This object.
494    */
495   @FluentSetter
496   public RestRequest urlEnc() {
497      return serializer(UrlEncodingSerializer.class).parser(UrlEncodingParser.class);
498   }
499
500   /**
501    * Convenience method for specifying OpenAPI as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
502    *
503    * <p>
504    * OpenAPI is a language that allows serialization to formats that use {@link HttpPartSchema} objects to describe their structure.
505    *
506    * <p>
507    *    {@link OpenApiSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
508    *    <ul>
509    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
510    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
511    *       <li>Typically the {@link RestRequest#content(Object, HttpPartSchema)} method will be used to specify the body of the request with the
512    *          schema describing it's structure.
513    *    </ul>
514    * <p>
515    *    {@link OpenApiParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
516    *    <ul>
517    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
518    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
519    *       <li>Typically the {@link ResponseContent#schema(HttpPartSchema)} method will be used to specify the structure of the response body.
520    *    </ul>
521    * <p>
522    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/openapi"</js> unless overridden
523    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
524    * <p>
525    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/openapi"</js> unless overridden
526    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
527    * <p>
528    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(OpenApiSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(OpenApiParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
529    *
530    * @return This object.
531    */
532   @FluentSetter
533   public RestRequest openApi() {
534      return serializer(OpenApiSerializer.class).parser(OpenApiParser.class);
535   }
536
537   /**
538    * Specifies the serializer to use on the request body.
539    *
540    * <p>
541    * Overrides the serializers specified on the {@link RestClient}.
542    *
543    * <p>
544    *    The serializer is not modified by an of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
545    *    bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
546    *
547    * <p>
548    * If the <c>Content-Type</c> header is not set on the request, it will be set to the media type of this serializer.
549    *
550    * @param serializer The serializer used to serialize POJOs to the body of the HTTP request.
551    * @return This object.
552    */
553   @FluentSetter
554   public RestRequest serializer(Serializer serializer) {
555      this.serializer = serializer;
556      return this;
557   }
558
559   /**
560    * Specifies the serializer to use on the request body.
561    *
562    * <p>
563    * Overrides the serializers specified on the {@link RestClient}.
564    *
565    * <p>
566    *    The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
567    *    bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
568    *
569    * <p>
570    * If the <c>Content-Type</c> header is not set on the request, it will be set to the media type of this serializer.
571    *
572    * @param serializer The serializer used to serialize POJOs to the body of the HTTP request.
573    * @return This object.
574    */
575   @FluentSetter
576   public RestRequest serializer(Class<? extends Serializer> serializer) {
577      this.serializer = client.getInstance(serializer);
578      return this;
579   }
580
581   /**
582    * Specifies the parser to use on the response body.
583    *
584    * <p>
585    * Overrides the parsers specified on the {@link RestClient}.
586    *
587    * <p>
588    *    The parser is not modified by any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
589    *    bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
590    *
591    * <p>
592    * If the <c>Accept</c> header is not set on the request, it will be set to the media type of this parser.
593    *
594    * @param parser The parser used to parse POJOs from the body of the HTTP response.
595    * @return This object.
596    */
597   @FluentSetter
598   public RestRequest parser(Parser parser) {
599      this.parser = parser;
600      return this;
601   }
602
603   /**
604    * Specifies the parser to use on the response body.
605    *
606    * <p>
607    * Overrides the parsers specified on the {@link RestClient}.
608    *
609    * <p>
610    *    The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
611    *    bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
612    *
613    * <p>
614    * If the <c>Accept</c> header is not set on the request, it will be set to the media type of this parser.
615    *
616    * @param parser The parser used to parse POJOs from the body of the HTTP response.
617    * @return This object.
618    */
619   @FluentSetter
620   public RestRequest parser(Class<? extends Parser> parser) {
621      this.parser = client.getInstance(parser);
622      return this;
623   }
624
625   /**
626    * Allows you to override what status codes are considered error codes that would result in a {@link RestCallException}.
627    *
628    * <p>
629    * The default error code predicate is: <code>x -&gt; x &gt;= 400</code>.
630    *
631    * @param value The new predicate for calculating error codes.
632    * @return This object.
633    */
634   @FluentSetter
635   public RestRequest errorCodes(Predicate<Integer> value) {
636      this.errorCodes = value;
637      return this;
638   }
639
640   /**
641    * Add one or more interceptors for this call only.
642    *
643    * @param interceptors The interceptors to add to this call.
644    * @return This object.
645    * @throws RestCallException If init method on interceptor threw an exception.
646    */
647   @FluentSetter
648   public RestRequest interceptors(RestCallInterceptor...interceptors) throws RestCallException {
649      try {
650         for (RestCallInterceptor i : interceptors) {
651            this.interceptors.add(i);
652            i.onInit(this);
653         }
654      } catch (RuntimeException | RestCallException e) {
655         throw e;
656      } catch (Exception e) {
657         throw new RestCallException(null, e, "Interceptor threw an exception on init.");
658      }
659
660      return this;
661   }
662
663   /**
664    * Prevent {@link RestCallException RestCallExceptions} from being thrown when HTTP status 400+ is encountered.
665    *
666    * <p>
667    * This overrides the <l>ignoreErrors</l> property on the client.
668    *
669    * @return This object.
670    */
671   @FluentSetter
672   public RestRequest ignoreErrors() {
673      this.ignoreErrors = true;
674      return this;
675   }
676
677   /**
678    * Rethrow any of the specified exception types if a matching <c>Exception-Name</c> header is found.
679    *
680    * <p>
681    * Rethrown exceptions will be set on the caused-by exception of {@link RestCallException} when
682    * thrown from the {@link #run()} method.
683    *
684    * <p>
685    * Can be called multiple times to append multiple rethrows.
686    *
687    * @param values The classes to rethrow.
688    * @return This object.
689    */
690   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
691   @FluentSetter
692   public RestRequest rethrow(Class<?>...values) {
693      if (rethrow == null)
694         rethrow = list();
695      for (Class<?> v : values) {
696         if (v != null && Throwable.class.isAssignableFrom(v))
697            rethrow.add((Class<? extends Throwable>)v);
698      }
699      return this;
700   }
701
702   /**
703    * Sets <c>Debug: value</c> header on this request.
704    *
705    * @return This object.
706    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
707    */
708   @FluentSetter
709   public RestRequest debug() throws RestCallException {
710      header("Debug", true);
711      return this;
712   }
713
714   /**
715    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if debug mode is currently enabled.
716    */
717   @Override
718   public boolean isDebug() {
719      return headerData.get("Debug", Boolean.class).orElse(false);
720   }
721
722   /**
723    * Causes logging to be suppressed for the duration of this request.
724    *
725    * <p>
726    * Overrides the {@link #debug()} setting on this request or client.
727    *
728    * @return This object.
729    */
730   @FluentSetter
731   public RestRequest suppressLogging() {
732      this.suppressLogging = true;
733      return this;
734   }
735
736   boolean isLoggingSuppressed() {
737      return suppressLogging;
738   }

740   /**
741    * Specifies the target host for the request.
742    *
743    * @param target The target host for the request.
744    *    Implementations may accept <jk>null</jk> if they can still determine a route, for example to a default
745    *    target or by inspecting the request.
746    * @return This object.
747    */
748   @FluentSetter
749   public RestRequest target(HttpHost target) {
750      this.target = target;
751      return this;
752   }

754   /**
755    * Override the context to use for the execution.
756    *
757    * @param context The context to use for the execution, or <jk>null</jk> to use the default context.
758    * @return This object.
759    */
760   @FluentSetter
761   public RestRequest context(HttpContext context) {
762      this.context = context;
763      return this;
764   }

810   /**
811    * Appends a header to the request.
812    *
813    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
814    * <p class='bjava'>
815    *    <jc>// Adds header "Foo: bar".</jc>
816    *    <jv>client</jv>
817    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
818    *       .header(Accept.<jsf>TEXT_XML</jsf>)
819    *       .run();
820    * </p>
821    *
822    * @param part
823    *    The parameter to set.
824    *    <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
825    * @return This object.
826    */
827   @FluentSetter
828   public RestRequest header(Header part) {
829      return headers(part);
830   }
831
832   /**
833    * Appends multiple headers to the request.
834    *
835    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
836    * <p class='bjava'>
837    *    <jc>// Appends two headers to the request.</jc>
838    *    <jv>client</jv>
839    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
840    *       .headers(
841    *          BasicHeader.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"Foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>),
842    *          Accept.<jsf>TEXT_XML</jsf>
843    *       )
844    *       .run();
845    * </p>
846    *
847    * @param parts
848    *    The parameters to set.
849    *    <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
850    * @return This object.
851    */
852   @FluentSetter
853   public RestRequest headers(Header...parts) {
854      headerData.append(parts);
855      return this;
856   }
857
858   /**
859    * Appends multiple query parameters to the request.
860    *
861    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
862    * <p class='bjava'>
863    *    <jc>// Appends two query parameters to the request.</jc>
864    *    <jv>client</jv>
865    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
866    *       .queryData(
867    *          BasicStringPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>),
868    *          BasicBooleanPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"baz"</js>, <jk>true</jk>)
869    *       )
870    *       .run();
871    * </p>
872    *
873    * @param parts
874    *    The parameters to set.
875    *    <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
876    * @return This object.
877    */
878   @FluentSetter
879   public RestRequest queryData(NameValuePair...parts) {
880      queryData.append(parts);
881      return this;
882   }
883
884   /**
885    * Appends multiple form-data parameters to the request.
886    *
887    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
888    * <p class='bjava'>
889    *    <jc>// Appends two form-data parameters to the request.</jc>
890    *    <jv>client</jv>
891    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
892    *       .formData(
893    *          BasicStringPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>),
894    *          BasicBooleanPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"baz"</js>, <jk>true</jk>)
895    *       )
896    *       .run();
897    * </p>
898    *
899    * @param parts
900    *    The parameters to set.
901    *    <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
902    * @return This object.
903    */
904   @FluentSetter
905   public RestRequest formData(NameValuePair...parts) {
906      formData.append(parts);
907      return this;
908   }
909
910   /**
911    * Sets or replaces multiple path parameters on the request.
912    *
913    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
914    * <p class='bjava'>
915    *    <jc>// Appends two path parameters to the request.</jc>
916    *    <jv>client</jv>
917    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
918    *       .pathData(
919    *          BasicStringPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>),
920    *          BasicBooleanPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"baz"</js>, <jk>true</jk>)
921    *       )
922    *       .run();
923    * </p>
924    *
925    * @param parts
926    *    The parameters to set.
927    *    <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
928    * @return This object.
929    */
930   @FluentSetter
931   public RestRequest pathData(NameValuePair...parts) {
932      pathData.set(parts);
933      return this;
934   }
935
936   /**
937    * Appends a header to the request.
938    *
939    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
940    * <p class='bjava'>
941    *    <jc>// Adds header "Foo: bar".</jc>
942    *    <jv>client</jv>
943    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
944    *       .header(<js>"Foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>)
945    *       .run();
946    * </p>
947    *
948    * @param name
949    *    The parameter name.
950    * @param value
951    *    The parameter value.
952    *    <br>Non-string values are converted to strings using the {@link HttpPartSerializer} defined on the client.
953    * @return This object.
954    */
955   @FluentSetter
956   public RestRequest header(String name, Object value) {
957      headerData.append(createHeader(name, value));
958      return this;
959   }
960
961   /**
962    * Appends a query parameter to the URI of the request.
963    *
964    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
965    * <p class='bjava'>
966    *    <jc>// Adds query parameter "foo=bar".</jc>
967    *    <jv>client</jv>
968    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
969    *       .queryData(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>)
970    *       .run();
971    * </p>
972    *
973    * @param name
974    *    The parameter name.
975    * @param value
976    *    The parameter value.
977    *    <br>Non-string values are converted to strings using the {@link HttpPartSerializer} defined on the client.
978    * @return This object.
979    */
980   @FluentSetter
981   public RestRequest queryData(String name, Object value) {
982      queryData.append(createPart(QUERY, name, value));
983      return this;
984   }
985
986   /**
987    * Adds a form-data parameter to the request body.
988    *
989    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
990    * <p class='bjava'>
991    *    <jc>// Adds form data parameter "foo=bar".</jc>
992    *    <jv>client</jv>
993    *       .formPost(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
994    *       .formData(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>)
995    *       .run();
996    * </p>
997    *
998    * @param name
999    *    The parameter name.
1000    * @param value
1001    *    The parameter value.
1002    *    <br>Non-string values are converted to strings using the {@link HttpPartSerializer} defined on the client.
1003    * @return This object.
1004    */
1005   @FluentSetter
1006   public RestRequest formData(String name, Object value) {
1007      formData.append(createPart(FORMDATA, name, value));
1008      return this;
1009   }
1010
1011   /**
1012    * Sets or replaces a path parameter of the form <js>"{name}"</js> in the URI.
1013    *
1014    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1015    * <p class='bjava'>
1016    *    <jc>// Sets path to "/bar".</jc>
1017    *    <jv>client</jv>
1018    *       .get(<js>"/{foo}"</js>)
1019    *       .pathData(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>)
1020    *       .run();
1021    * </p>
1022    *
1023    * @param name
1024    *    The parameter name.
1025    * @param value
1026    *    The parameter value.
1027    *    <br>Non-string values are converted to strings using the {@link HttpPartSerializer} defined on the client.
1028    * @return This object.
1029    */
1030   @FluentSetter
1031   public RestRequest pathData(String name, Object value) {
1032      pathData.set(createPart(PATH, name, value));
1033      return this;
1034   }
1035
1036   /**
1037    * Appends multiple headers to the request using freeform key/value pairs.
1038    *
1039    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1040    * <p class='bjava'>
1041    *    <jc>// Adds headers "Foo: bar" and "Baz: qux".</jc>
1042    *    <jv>client</jv>
1043    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1044    *       .headerPairs(<js>"Foo"</js>,<js>"bar"</js>,<js>"Baz"</js>,<js>"qux"</js>)
1045    *       .run();
1046    * </p>
1047    *
1048    * @param pairs The form-data key/value pairs.
1049    * @return This object.
1050    */
1051   @FluentSetter
1052   public RestRequest headerPairs(String...pairs) {
1053      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
1054         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Odd number of parameters passed into headerPairs(String...)");
1055      HeaderList b = headerData;
1056      for (int i = 0; i < pairs.length; i+=2)
1057         b.append(pairs[i], pairs[i+1]);
1058      return this;
1059   }
1060
1061   /**
1062    * Adds query parameters to the URI query using free-form key/value pairs..
1063    *
1064    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1065    * <p class='bjava'>
1066    *    <jc>// Adds query parameters "foo=bar&amp;baz=qux".</jc>
1067    *    <jv>client</jv>
1068    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1069    *       .queryDataPairs(<js>"foo"</js>,<js>"bar"</js>,<js>"baz"</js>,<js>"qux"</js>)
1070    *       .run();
1071    * </p>
1072    *
1073    * @param pairs The query key/value pairs.
1074    *    <ul>
1075    *       <li>Values can be any POJO.
1076    *       <li>Values converted to a string using the configured part serializer.
1077    *    </ul>
1078    * @return This object.
1079    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1080    */
1081   @FluentSetter
1082   public RestRequest queryDataPairs(String...pairs) throws RestCallException {
1083      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
1084         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Odd number of parameters passed into queryDataPairs(String...)");
1085      PartList b = queryData;
1086      for (int i = 0; i < pairs.length; i+=2)
1087         b.append(pairs[i], pairs[i+1]);
1088      return this;
1089   }
1090
1091   /**
1092    * Adds form-data parameters to the request body using free-form key/value pairs.
1093    *
1094    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1095    * <p class='bjava'>
1096    *    <jc>// Creates form data "key1=val1&amp;key2=val2".</jc>
1097    *    <jv>client</jv>
1098    *       .formPost(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1099    *       .formDataPairs(<js>"key1"</js>,<js>"val1"</js>,<js>"key2"</js>,<js>"val2"</js>)
1100    *       .run();
1101    * </p>
1102    *
1103    * @param pairs The form-data key/value pairs.
1104    *    <ul>
1105    *       <li>Values can be any POJO.
1106    *       <li>Values converted to a string using the configured part serializer.
1107    *    </ul>
1108    * @return This object.
1109    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1110    */
1111   @FluentSetter
1112   public RestRequest formDataPairs(String...pairs) throws RestCallException {
1113      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
1114         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Odd number of parameters passed into formDataPairs(String...)");
1115      PartList b = formData;
1116      for (int i = 0; i < pairs.length; i+=2)
1117         b.append(pairs[i], pairs[i+1]);
1118      return this;
1119   }
1120
1121   /**
1122    * Replaces path parameters of the form <js>"{name}"</js> in the URI using free-form key/value pairs.
1123    *
1124    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1125    * <p class='bjava'>
1126    *    <jc>// Sets path to "/baz/qux".</jc>
1127    *    <jv>client</jv>
1128    *       .get(<js>"/{foo}/{bar}"</js>)
1129    *       .pathDataPairs(
1130    *          <js>"foo"</js>,<js>"baz"</js>,
1131    *          <js>"bar"</js>,<js>"qux"</js>
1132    *       )
1133    *       .run();
1134    * </p>
1135    *
1136    * @param pairs The path key/value pairs.
1137    *    <ul>
1138    *       <li>Values can be any POJO.
1139    *       <li>Values converted to a string using the configured part serializer.
1140    *    </ul>
1141    * @return This object.
1142    */
1143   @FluentSetter
1144   public RestRequest pathDataPairs(String...pairs) {
1145      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
1146         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Odd number of parameters passed into pathDataPairs(String...)");
1147      PartList b = pathData;
1148      for (int i = 0; i < pairs.length; i+=2)
1149         b.set(pairs[i], pairs[i+1]);
1150      return this;
1151   }
1152
1153   /**
1154    * Appends multiple headers to the request from properties defined on a Java bean.
1155    *
1156    * <p>
1157    * Uses {@link PropertyNamerDUCS} for resolving the header names from property names.
1158    *
1159    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1160    * <p class='bjava'>
1161    *    <ja>@Bean</ja>
1162    *    <jk>public class</jk> MyHeaders {
1163    *       <jk>public</jk> String getFooBar() { <jk>return</jk> <js>"baz"</js>; }
1164    *       <jk>public</jk> Integer getQux() { <jk>return</jk> 123; }
1165    *    }
1166    *
1167    *    <jc>// Appends headers "Foo-Bar: baz" and "Qux: 123".</jc>
1168    *    <jv>client</jv>
1169    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1170    *       .headersBean(<jk>new</jk> MyHeaders())
1171    *       .run();
1172    * </p>
1173    *
1174    * @param value The bean containing the properties to set as header values.
1175    * @return This object.
1176    */
1177   @FluentSetter
1178   public RestRequest headersBean(Object value) {
1179      if (! isBean(value))
1180         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Object passed into headersBean(Object) is not a bean.");
1181      HeaderList b = headerData;
1182      toBeanMap(value, PropertyNamerDUCS.INSTANCE).forEach((k,v) -> b.append(createHeader(k, v)));
1183      return this;
1184   }
1185
1186   /**
1187    * Appends multiple query parameters to the request from properties defined on a Java bean.
1188    *
1189    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1190    * <p class='bjava'>
1191    *    <jk>public class</jk> MyQuery {
1192    *       <jk>public</jk> String getFooBar() { <jk>return</jk> <js>"baz"</js>; }
1193    *       <jk>public</jk> Integer getQux() { <jk>return</jk> 123; }
1194    *    }
1195    *
1196    *    <jc>// Appends query "fooBar=baz&amp;qux=123".</jc>
1197    *    <jv>client</jv>
1198    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1199    *       .queryDataBean(<jk>new</jk> MyQuery())
1200    *       .run();
1201    * </p>
1202    *
1203    * @param value The bean containing the properties to set as query parameter values.
1204    * @return This object.
1205    */
1206   @FluentSetter
1207   public RestRequest queryDataBean(Object value) {
1208      if (! isBean(value))
1209         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Object passed into queryDataBean(Object) is not a bean.");
1210      PartList b = queryData;
1211      toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> b.append(createPart(QUERY, k, v)));
1212      return this;
1213   }
1214
1215   /**
1216    * Appends multiple form-data parameters to the request from properties defined on a Java bean.
1217    *
1218    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1219    * <p class='bjava'>
1220    *    <jk>public class</jk> MyFormData {
1221    *       <jk>public</jk> String getFooBar() { <jk>return</jk> <js>"baz"</js>; }
1222    *       <jk>public</jk> Integer getQux() { <jk>return</jk> 123; }
1223    *    }
1224    *
1225    *    <jc>// Appends form data "fooBar=baz&amp;qux=123".</jc>
1226    *    <jv>client</jv>
1227    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1228    *       .formDataBean(<jk>new</jk> MyFormData())
1229    *       .run();
1230    * </p>
1231    *
1232    * @param value The bean containing the properties to set as form-data parameter values.
1233    * @return This object.
1234    */
1235   @FluentSetter
1236   public RestRequest formDataBean(Object value) {
1237      if (! isBean(value))
1238         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Object passed into formDataBean(Object) is not a bean.");
1239      PartList b = formData;
1240      toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> b.append(createPart(FORMDATA, k, v)));
1241      return this;
1242   }
1243
1244   /**
1245    * Sets multiple path parameters to the request from properties defined on a Java bean.
1246    *
1247    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1248    * <p class='bjava'>
1249    *    <jk>public class</jk> MyPathVars {
1250    *       <jk>public</jk> String getFooBar() { <jk>return</jk> <js>"baz"</js>; }
1251    *       <jk>public</jk> Integer getQux() { <jk>return</jk> 123; }
1252    *    }
1253    *
1254    *    <jc>// Given path "/{fooBar}/{qux}/", gets converted to "/baz/123/".</jc>
1255    *    <jv>client</jv>
1256    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1257    *       .pathDataBean(<jk>new</jk> MyPathVars())
1258    *       .run();
1259    * </p>
1260    *
1261    * @param value The bean containing the properties to set as path parameter values.
1262    * @return This object.
1263    */
1264   @FluentSetter
1265   public RestRequest pathDataBean(Object value) {
1266      if (! isBean(value))
1267         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Object passed into pathDataBean(Object) is not a bean.");
1268      PartList b = pathData;
1269      toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> b.set(createPart(PATH, k, v)));
1270      return this;
1271   }

1273   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1274   // URI
1275   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1276
1277   /**
1278    * Sets the URI for this request.
1279    *
1280    * <p>
1281    * Can be any of the following types:
1282    * <ul>
1283    *    <li>{@link URI}
1284    *    <li>{@link URL}
1285    *    <li>{@link URIBuilder}
1286    *    <li>Anything else converted to a string using {@link Object#toString()}.
1287    * </ul>
1288    *
1289    * <p>
1290    * Relative URI strings will be interpreted as relative to the root URI defined on the client.
1291    *
1292    * @param uri
1293    *    The URI of the remote REST resource.
1294    *    <br>This overrides the URI passed in from the client.
1295    *    <br>Can be any of the following types:
1296    *    <ul>
1297    *       <li>{@link URIBuilder}
1298    *       <li>{@link URI}
1299    *       <li>{@link URL}
1300    *       <li>{@link String}
1301    *       <li>{@link Object} - Converted to <c>String</c> using <c>toString()</c>
1302    *    </ul>
1303    * @return This object.
1304    * @throws RestCallException Invalid URI syntax detected.
1305    */
1306   @FluentSetter
1307   public RestRequest uri(Object uri) throws RestCallException {
1308      URI x = client.toURI(uri, null);
1309      if (x.getScheme() != null)
1310         uriBuilder.setScheme(x.getScheme());
1311      if (x.getHost() != null)
1312         uriBuilder.setHost(x.getHost());
1313      if (x.getPort() != -1)
1314         uriBuilder.setPort(x.getPort());
1315      if (x.getUserInfo() != null)
1316         uriBuilder.setUserInfo(x.getUserInfo());
1317      if (x.getFragment() != null)
1318         uriBuilder.setFragment(x.getFragment());
1319      if (x.getQuery() != null)
1320         uriBuilder.setCustomQuery(x.getQuery());
1321      uriBuilder.setPath(x.getPath());
1322      return this;
1323   }
1324
1325   /**
1326    * Sets the URI scheme.
1327    *
1328    * @param scheme The new URI host.
1329    * @return This object.
1330    */
1331   @FluentSetter
1332   public RestRequest uriScheme(String scheme) {
1333      uriBuilder.setScheme(scheme);
1334      return this;
1335   }
1336
1337   /**
1338    * Sets the URI host.
1339    *
1340    * @param host The new URI host.
1341    * @return This object.
1342    */
1343   @FluentSetter
1344   public RestRequest uriHost(String host) {
1345      uriBuilder.setHost(host);
1346      return this;
1347   }
1348
1349   /**
1350    * Sets the URI port.
1351    *
1352    * @param port The new URI port.
1353    * @return This object.
1354    */
1355   @FluentSetter
1356   public RestRequest uriPort(int port) {
1357      uriBuilder.setPort(port);
1358      return this;
1359   }
1360
1361   /**
1362    * Sets the URI user info.
1363    *
1364    * @param userInfo The new URI user info.
1365    * @return This object.
1366    */
1367   @FluentSetter
1368   public RestRequest uriUserInfo(String userInfo) {
1369      uriBuilder.setUserInfo(userInfo);
1370      return this;
1371   }

1381   public RestRequest uriUserInfo(String username, String password) {
1382      uriBuilder.setUserInfo(username, password);
1383      return this;
