1386   /**
1387    * Sets the URI fragment.
1388    *
1389    * @param fragment The URI fragment.  The value is expected to be unescaped and may contain non ASCII characters.
1390    * @return This object.
1391    */
1392   @FluentSetter
1393   public RestRequest uriFragment(String fragment) {
1394      uriBuilder.setFragment(fragment);
1395      return this;
1396   }
1397
1398   /**
1399    * Adds a free-form custom query.
1400    *
1401    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1402    * <p class='bjava'>
1403    *    <jc>// Adds query parameter "foo=bar&amp;baz=qux".</jc>
1404    *    <jv>client</jv>
1405    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1406    *       .queryCustom(<js>"foo=bar&amp;baz=qux"</js>)
1407    *       .run();
1408    * </p>
1409    *
1410    * @param value The parameter value.
1411    *    <br>Can be any of the following types:
1412    *    <ul>
1413    *       <li>
1414    *          {@link CharSequence}
1415    *       <li>
1416    *          {@link Reader} - Raw contents of {@code Reader} will be serialized to remote resource.
1417    *       <li>
1418    *          {@link InputStream} - Raw contents of {@code InputStream} will be serialized to remote resource.
1419    *       <li>
1420    *          {@link PartList} - Converted to a URL-encoded query.
1421    *    </ul>
1422    * @return This object.
1423    */
1424   @FluentSetter
1425   public RestRequest queryCustom(Object value) {
1426      try {
1427         String q = null;
1428         if (value instanceof Reader)
1429            q = read((Reader)value);
1430         else if (value instanceof InputStream)
1431            q = read((InputStream)value);
1432         else
1433            q = Utils.s(value);  // Works for NameValuePairs.
1434         uriBuilder.setCustomQuery(q);
1435      } catch (IOException e) {
1436         throw new BasicRuntimeException(e, "Could not read custom query.");
1437      }
1438      return this;
1439   }
1440
1441   /**
1442    * Adds form-data parameters as the entire body of the request.
1443    *
1444    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1445    * <p class='bjava'>
1446    *    <jc>// Creates form data "foo=bar&amp;baz=qux".</jc>
1447    *    <jv>client</jv>
1448    *       .formPost(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1449    *       .formDataCustom(<js>"foo=bar&amp;baz=qux"</js>)
1450    *       .run();
1451    *
1452    *    <jc>// Creates form data "foo=bar&amp;baz=qux" using StringEntity.</jc>
1453    *    <jv>client</jv>
1454    *       .formPost(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1455    *       .formDataCustom(<jk>new</jk> StringEntity(<js>"foo=bar&amp;baz=qux"</js>,<js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js>))
1456    *       .run();
1457    *
1458    *    <jc>// Creates form data "foo=bar&amp;baz=qux" using StringEntity and body().</jc>
1459    *    <jv>client</jv>
1460    *       .formPost(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1461    *       .content(<jk>new</jk> StringEntity(<js>"foo=bar&amp;baz=qux"</js>,<js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js>))
1462    *       .run();
1463    * </p>
1464    *
1465    * @param value The parameter value.
1466    *    <br>Can be any of the following types:
1467    *    <ul class='spaced-list'>
1468    *       <li>
1469    *          {@link CharSequence}
1470    *       <li>
1471    *          {@link Reader} - Raw contents of {@code Reader} will be serialized to remote resource.
1472    *       <li>
1473    *          {@link InputStream} - Raw contents of {@code InputStream} will be serialized to remote resource.
1474    *       <li>
1475    *          {@link HttpResource} - Raw contents will be serialized to remote resource.  Additional headers and media type will be set on request.
1476    *       <li>
1477    *          {@link HttpEntity}/{@link BasicHttpEntity} - Bypass Juneau serialization and pass HttpEntity directly to HttpClient.
1478    *       <li>
1479    *          {@link Object} - POJO to be converted to text using the {@link Serializer} registered with the
1480    *          {@link RestClient}.
1481    *       <li>
1482    *          {@link PartList} - Converted to a URL-encoded FORM post.
1483    *    </ul>
1484    * @return This object.
1485    */
1486   @FluentSetter
1487   public RestRequest formDataCustom(Object value) {
1488      header(ContentType.APPLICATION_FORM_URLENCODED);
1489      content(value instanceof CharSequence ? new StringReader(value.toString()) : value);
1490      return this;
1491   }
1492
1493   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1494   // Args
1495   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1496
1497   RestRequest headerArg(String name, Object value, HttpPartSchema schema, HttpPartSerializer serializer, boolean skipIfEmpty) {
1498      boolean isMulti = isEmpty(name) || "*".equals(name) || value instanceof HeaderList || isHeaderArray(value);
1499
1500      if (! isMulti) {
1501         if (! (skipIfEmpty && isEmpty(Utils.s(value))))
1502            return header(createHeader(name, value, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty));
1503         return this;
1504      }
1505
1506      List<Header> l = list();
1507
1508      if (HttpHeaders.canCast(value)) {
1509         l.add(HttpHeaders.cast(value));
1510      } else if (value instanceof HeaderList) {
1511         ((HeaderList)value).forEach(x->l.add(x));
1512      } else if (value instanceof Collection) {
1513         ((Collection<?>)value).forEach(x -> l.add(HttpHeaders.cast(x)));
1514      } else if (isArray(value)) {
1515         for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(value); i++)
1516            l.add(HttpHeaders.cast(Array.get(value, i)));
1517      } else if (value instanceof Map) {
1518         toMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createHeader(Utils.s(k), v, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty)));
1519      } else if (isBean(value)) {
1520         toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createHeader(k, v, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty)));
1521      } else if (value != null) {
1522         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid value type for header arg ''{0}'': {1}", name, className(value));
1523      }
1524
1525      if (skipIfEmpty)
1526         l.removeIf(x -> isEmpty(x.getValue()));
1527
1528      headerData.append(l);
1529
1530      return this;
1531   }
1532
1533   RestRequest queryArg(String name, Object value, HttpPartSchema schema, HttpPartSerializer serializer, boolean skipIfEmpty) {
1534      boolean isMulti = isEmpty(name) || "*".equals(name) || value instanceof PartList || isNameValuePairArray(value);
1535
1536      if (! isMulti) {
1537         if (! (skipIfEmpty && isEmpty(Utils.s(value))))
1538            return queryData(createPart(name, value, QUERY, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty));
1539         return this;
1540      }
1541
1542      List<NameValuePair> l = list();
1543
1544      if (HttpParts.canCast(value)) {
1545         l.add(HttpParts.cast(value));
1546      } else if (value instanceof PartList) {
1547         ((PartList)value).forEach(x->l.add(x));
1548      } else if (value instanceof Collection) {
1549         ((Collection<?>)value).forEach(x -> l.add(HttpParts.cast(x)));
1550      } else if (isArray(value)) {
1551         for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(value); i++)
1552            l.add(HttpParts.cast(Array.get(value, i)));
1553      } else if (value instanceof Map) {
1554         toMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createPart(Utils.s(k), v, QUERY, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty)));
1555      } else if (isBean(value)) {
1556         toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createPart(k, v, QUERY, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty)));
1557      } else if (value != null) {
1558         queryCustom(value);
1559         return this;
1560      }
1561
1562      if (skipIfEmpty)
1563         l.removeIf(x -> isEmpty(x.getValue()));
1564
1565      queryData.append(l);
1566
1567      return this;
1568   }
1569
1570   RestRequest formDataArg(String name, Object value, HttpPartSchema schema, HttpPartSerializer serializer, boolean skipIfEmpty) {
1571      boolean isMulti = isEmpty(name) || "*".equals(name) || value instanceof PartList || isNameValuePairArray(value);
1572
1573      if (! isMulti) {
1574         if (! (skipIfEmpty && isEmpty(Utils.s(value))))
1575            return formData(createPart(name, value, FORMDATA, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty));
1576         return this;
1577      }
1578
1579      List<NameValuePair> l = list();
1580
1581      if (HttpParts.canCast(value)) {
1582         l.add(HttpParts.cast(value));
1583      } else if (value instanceof PartList) {
1584         ((PartList)value).forEach(x->l.add(x));
1585      } else if (value instanceof Collection) {
1586         ((Collection<?>)value).forEach(x -> l.add(HttpParts.cast(x)));
1587      } else if (isArray(value)) {
1588         for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(value); i++)
1589            l.add(HttpParts.cast(Array.get(value, i)));
1590      } else if (value instanceof Map) {
1591         toMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createPart(Utils.s(k), v, FORMDATA, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty)));
1592      } else if (isBean(value)) {
1593         toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createPart(k, v, FORMDATA, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty)));
1594      } else if (value != null) {
1595         formDataCustom(value);
1596         return this;
1597      }
1598
1599      if (skipIfEmpty)
1600         l.removeIf(x -> isEmpty(x.getValue()));
1601
1602      formData.append(l);
1603
1604      return this;
1605   }
1606
1607   RestRequest pathArg(String name, Object value, HttpPartSchema schema, HttpPartSerializer serializer) {
1608      boolean isMulti = isEmpty(name) || "*".equals(name) || value instanceof PartList || isNameValuePairArray(value);
1609
1610      if (! isMulti)
1611         return pathData(createPart(name, value, PATH, serializer, schema, false));
1612
1613      List<NameValuePair> l = list();
1614
1615      if (HttpParts.canCast(value)) {
1616         l.add(HttpParts.cast(value));
1617      } else if (value instanceof PartList) {
1618         ((PartList)value).forEach(x->l.add(x));
1619      } else if (value instanceof Collection) {
1620         ((Collection<?>)value).forEach(x -> l.add(HttpParts.cast(x)));
1621      } else if (isArray(value)) {
1622         for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(value); i++)
1623            l.add(HttpParts.cast(Array.get(value, i)));
1624      } else if (value instanceof Map) {
1625         toMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createPart(Utils.s(k), v, PATH, serializer, schema, false)));
1626      } else if (isBean(value)) {
1627         toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createPart(k, v, PATH, serializer, schema, false)));
1628      } else if (value != null) {
1629         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid value type for path arg ''{0}'': {1}", name, className(value));
1630      }
1631
1632      pathData.append(l);
1633
1634      return this;
1635   }
1636
1637   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1638   // Request body
1639   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1640
1641   /**
1642    * Sets the body of this request.
1643    *
1644    * @param value
1645    *    The input to be sent to the REST resource (only valid for PUT/POST/PATCH) requests.
1646    *    <br>Can be of the following types:
1647    *    <ul class='spaced-list'>
1648    *       <li>
1649    *          {@link Reader} - Raw contents of {@code Reader} will be serialized to remote resource.
1650    *       <li>
1651    *          {@link InputStream} - Raw contents of {@code InputStream} will be serialized to remote resource.
1652    *       <li>
1653    *          {@link HttpResource} - Raw contents will be serialized to remote resource.  Additional headers and media type will be set on request.
1654    *       <li>
1655    *          {@link HttpEntity}/{@link BasicHttpEntity} - Bypass Juneau serialization and pass HttpEntity directly to HttpClient.
1656    *       <li>
1657    *          {@link Object} - POJO to be converted to text using the {@link Serializer} registered with the
1658    *          {@link RestClient}.
1659    *       <li>
1660    *          {@link PartList} - Converted to a URL-encoded FORM post.
1661    *       <li>
1662    *          A {@link Supplier} of anything on this list.
1663    *    </ul>
1664    * @return This object.
1665    */
1666   @FluentSetter
1667   public RestRequest content(Object value) {
1668      this.content = value;
1669      return this;
1670   }
1671
1672   /**
1673    * Sets the body of this request as straight text bypassing the serializer.
1674    *
1675    * <p class='bjava'>
1676    *    <jv>client</jv>
1677    *       .put(<js>"/foo"</js>)
1678    *       .content(<jk>new</jk> StringReader(<js>"foo"</js>))
1679    *       .contentType(<js>"text/foo"</js>)
1680    *       .run();
1681    *
1682    * <jv>client</jv>
1683    *       .put(<js>"/foo"</js>)
1684    *       .bodyString(<js>"foo"</js>)
1685    *       .run();
1686    * </p>
1687    *
1688    * <p>
1689    * Note that this is different than the following which will serialize <l>foo</l> as a JSON string <l>"foo"</l>.
1690    * <p class='bjava'>
1691    *    <jv>client</jv>
1692    *       .put(<js>"/foo"</js>)
1693    *       .json()
1694    *       .content(<js>"foo"</js>)
1695    *       .run();
1696    * </p>
1697    *
1698    * @param input
1699    *    The input to be sent to the REST resource (only valid for PUT/POST/PATCH) requests.
1700    * @return This object.
1701    * @throws RestCallException If a retry was attempted, but the entity was not repeatable.
1702    */
1703   @FluentSetter
1704   public RestRequest contentString(Object input) throws RestCallException {
1705      return content(input == null ? null : new StringReader(Utils.s(input)));
1706   }
1707
1708   /**
1709    * Sets the body of this request.
1710    *
1711    * @param input
1712    *    The input to be sent to the REST resource (only valid for PUT/POST/PATCH) requests.
1713    *    <br>Can be of the following types:
1714    *    <ul class='spaced-list'>
1715    *       <li>
1716    *          {@link Reader} - Raw contents of {@code Reader} will be serialized to remote resource.
1717    *       <li>
1718    *          {@link InputStream} - Raw contents of {@code InputStream} will be serialized to remote resource.
1719    *       <li>
1720    *          {@link HttpResource} - Raw contents will be serialized to remote resource.  Additional headers and media type will be set on request.
1721    *       <li>
1722    *          {@link HttpEntity}/{@link BasicHttpEntity} - Bypass Juneau serialization and pass HttpEntity directly to HttpClient.
1723    *       <li>
1724    *          {@link Object} - POJO to be converted to text using the {@link Serializer} registered with the
1725    *          {@link RestClient}.
1726    *       <li>
1727    *          {@link PartList} - Converted to a URL-encoded FORM post.
1728    *       <li>
1729    *          A {@link Supplier} of anything on this list.
1730    *    </ul>
1731    * @param schema The schema object that defines the format of the output.
1732    *    <ul>
1733    *       <li>If <jk>null</jk>, defaults to {@link HttpPartSchema#DEFAULT}.
1734    *       <li>Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. {@link OpenApiSerializer}).
1735    *    </ul>
1736    * @return This object.
1737    */
1738   @FluentSetter
1739   public RestRequest content(Object input, HttpPartSchema schema) {
1740      this.content = input;
1741      this.contentSchema = schema;
1742      return this;
1743   }
1744
1745   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1746   // Specialized headers.
1747   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1748
1749   /**
1750    * Sets the value for the <c>Accept</c> request header.
1751    *
1752    * <p>
1753    * This overrides the media type specified on the parser, but is overridden by calling
1754    * <code>header(<js>"Accept"</js>, value);</code>
1755    *
1756    * @param value The new header value.
1757    * @return This object.
1758    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1759    */
1760   @FluentSetter
1761   public RestRequest accept(String value) throws RestCallException {
1762      return header(Accept.of(value));
1763   }
1764
1765   /**
1766    * Sets the value for the <c>Accept-Charset</c> request header.
1767    *
1768    * <p>
1769    * This is a shortcut for calling <code>header(<js>"Accept-Charset"</js>, value);</code>
1770    *
1771    * @param value The new header value.
1772    * @return This object.
1773    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1774    */
1775   @FluentSetter
1776   public RestRequest acceptCharset(String value) throws RestCallException {
1777      return header(AcceptCharset.of(value));
1778   }
1779
1780   /**
1781    * Sets the value for the <c>Content-Type</c> request header.
1782    *
1783    * <p>
1784    * This overrides the media type specified on the serializer, but is overridden by calling
1785    * <code>header(<js>"Content-Type"</js>, value);</code>
1786    *
1787    * @param value The new header value.
1788    * @return This object.
1789    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1790    */
1791   @FluentSetter
1792   public RestRequest contentType(String value) throws RestCallException {
1793      return header(ContentType.of(value));
1794   }
1795
1796   /**
1797    * Shortcut for setting the <c>Accept</c> and <c>Content-Type</c> headers on a request.
1798    *
1799    * @param value The new header values.
1800    * @return This object.
1801    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1802    */
1803   @FluentSetter
1804   public RestRequest mediaType(String value) throws RestCallException {
1805      return header(Accept.of(value)).header(ContentType.of(value));
1806   }
1807
1808   /**
1809    * When called, <c>No-Trace: true</c> is added to requests.
1810    *
1811    * <p>
1812    * This gives the opportunity for the servlet to not log errors on invalid requests.
1813    * This is useful for testing purposes when you don't want your log file to show lots of errors that are simply the
1814    * results of testing.
1815    *
1816    * @return This object.
1817    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1818    */
1819   @FluentSetter
1820   public RestRequest noTrace() throws RestCallException {
1821      return header(NoTrace.TRUE);
1822   }
1823
1824   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1825   // Execution methods.
1826   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1827
1828   /**
1829    * Runs this request and returns the resulting response object.
1830    *
1831    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1832    * <p class='bjava'>
1833    *    <jk>try</jk> {
1834    *       <jk>int</jk> <jv>rc</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).execute().getResponseStatus();
1835    *       <jc>// Succeeded!</jc>
1836    *    } <jk>catch</jk> (RestCallException <jv>e</jv>) {
1837    *       <jc>// Failed!</jc>
1838    *    }
1839    * </p>
1840    *
1841    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1842    *    <li class='note'>Calling this method multiple times will return the same original response object.
1843    *    <li class='note'>You must close the returned object if you do not consume the response or execute a method that consumes
1844    *       the response.
1845    *    <li class='note'>If you are only interested in the response code, use the {@link #complete()} method which will automatically
1846    *       consume the response so that you don't need to call {@link InputStream#close()} on the response body.
1847    * </ul>
1848    *
1849    * @return The response object.
1850    * @throws RestCallException If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
1851    */
1852   public RestResponse run() throws RestCallException {
1853      if (response != null)
1854         throw new RestCallException(response, null, "run() already called.");
1855
1856      try {
1857
1858         queryData.stream().map(SimpleQuery::new).filter(SimplePart::isValid).forEach(
1859            x -> uriBuilder.addParameter(x.name, x.value)
1860         );
1861
1862         pathData.stream().map(SimplePath::new).forEach(x ->
1863            {
1864               String path = uriBuilder.getPath();
1865               String name = x.name, value = x.value;
1866               String var = "{" + name + "}";
1867               if (path.indexOf(var) == -1 && ! name.equals("/*"))
1868                  throw new IllegalStateException("Path variable {" + name + "} was not found in path.");
1869               if (name.equals("/*"))
1870                  path = path.replaceAll("\\/\\*$", "/" + value);
1871               else
1872                  path = path.replace(var, String.valueOf(value));
1873               uriBuilder.setPath(path);
1874            }
1875         );
1876
1877         HttpEntityEnclosingRequestBase request2 = request instanceof HttpEntityEnclosingRequestBase ? (HttpEntityEnclosingRequestBase)request : null;
1878         request.setURI(uriBuilder.build());
1879
1880         // Pick the serializer if it hasn't been overridden.
1881         HeaderList hl = headerData;
1882         Optional<Header> h = hl.getLast("Content-Type");
1883         String contentType = h.isPresent() ? h.get().getValue() : null;
1884         Serializer serializer = this.serializer;
1885         if (serializer == null)
1886            serializer = client.getMatchingSerializer(contentType);
1887         if (contentType == null && serializer != null)
1888            contentType = serializer.getPrimaryMediaType().toString();
1889
1890         // Pick the parser if it hasn't been overridden.
1891         h = hl.getLast("Accept");
1892         String accept = h.isPresent() ? h.get().getValue() : null;
1893         Parser parser = this.parser;
1894         if (parser == null)
1895            parser = client.getMatchingParser(accept);
1896         if (accept == null && parser != null)
1897            hl.set(Accept.of( parser.getPrimaryMediaType()));
1898
1899         headerData.stream().map(SimpleHeader::new).filter(SimplePart::isValid).forEach(x -> request.addHeader(x));
1900
1901         if (request2 == null && content != NO_BODY)
1902            throw new RestCallException(null, null, "Method does not support content entity.  Method={0}, URI={1}", getMethod(), getURI());
1903
1904         if (request2 != null) {
1905
1906            Object input2 = null;
1907            if (content != NO_BODY) {
1908               input2 = content;
1909            } else {
1910               input2 = new UrlEncodedFormEntity(formData.stream().map(SimpleFormData::new).filter(SimplePart::isValid).collect(toList()));
1911            }
1912
1913            if (input2 instanceof Supplier)
1914               input2 = ((Supplier<?>)input2).get();
1915
1916            HttpEntity entity = null;
1917            if (input2 instanceof PartList)
1918               entity = new UrlEncodedFormEntity(((PartList)input2).stream().map(SimpleFormData::new).filter(SimplePart::isValid).collect(toList()));
1919            else if (input2 instanceof HttpResource) {
1920               HttpResource r = (HttpResource)input2;
1921               r.getHeaders().forEach(x -> request.addHeader(x));
1922               entity = (HttpEntity)input2;
1923            }
1924            else if (input2 instanceof HttpEntity) {
1925               if (input2 instanceof SerializedEntity) {
1926                  entity = ((SerializedEntity)input2).copyWith(serializer, contentSchema);
1927               } else {
1928                  entity = (HttpEntity)input2;
1929               }
1930            }
1931            else if (input2 instanceof Reader)
1932               entity = readerEntity((Reader)input2, getRequestContentType(TEXT_PLAIN));
1933            else if (input2 instanceof InputStream)
1934               entity = streamEntity((InputStream)input2, -1, getRequestContentType(ContentType.APPLICATION_OCTET_STREAM));
1935            else if (serializer != null)
1936               entity = serializedEntity(input2, serializer, contentSchema).setContentType(contentType);
1937            else {
1938               if (client.hasSerializers()) {
1939                  if (contentType == null)
1940                     throw new RestCallException(null, null, "Content-Type not specified on request.  Cannot match correct serializer.  Use contentType(String) or mediaType(String) to specify transport language.");
1941                  throw new RestCallException(null, null, "No matching serializer for media type ''{0}''", contentType);
1942               }
1943               entity = stringEntity(input2 == null ? "" : BeanContext.DEFAULT.getClassMetaForObject(input2).toString(input2), getRequestContentType(TEXT_PLAIN));
1944            }
1945
1946            request2.setEntity(entity);
1947         }
1948
1949         try {
1950            response = client.createResponse(this, client.run(target, request, context), parser);
1951         } catch (Exception e) {
1952            throw e;
1953         }
1954
1955         if (isDebug() || client.logRequests == DetailLevel.FULL)
1956            response.cacheContent();
1957
1958         for (RestCallInterceptor rci : interceptors)
1959            rci.onConnect(this, response);
1960         client.onCallConnect(this, response);
1961
1962         String method = getMethod();
1963         int sc = response.getStatusCode();
1964
1965         Thrown thrown = response.getHeader("Thrown").asHeader(Thrown.class);
1966         if (thrown.isPresent() && rethrow != null) {
1967            Thrown.Part thrownPart = thrown.asParts().get().get(0);
1968            String className = thrownPart.getClassName();
1969            String message = thrownPart.getMessage();
1970            for (Class<? extends Throwable> t : rethrow) {
1971               if (t.getName().equals(className)) {
1972                  ConstructorInfo c = null;
1973                  ClassInfo ci = ClassInfo.of(t);
1974                  c = ci.getPublicConstructor(x -> x.hasParamTypes(HttpResponse.class));
1975                  if (c != null)
1976                     throw c.<Throwable>invoke(response);
1977                  c = ci.getPublicConstructor(x -> x.hasParamTypes(String.class));
1978                  if (c != null)
1979                     throw c.<Throwable>invoke(message != null ? message : response.getContent().asString());
1980                  c = ci.getPublicConstructor(x -> x.hasParamTypes(String.class,Throwable.class));
1981                  if (c != null)
1982                     throw c.<Throwable>invoke(message != null ? message : response.getContent().asString(), null);
1983                  c = ci.getPublicConstructor(ConstructorInfo::hasNoParams);
1984                  if (c != null)
1985                     throw c.<Throwable>invoke();
1986               }
1987            }
1988         }
1989
1990         if (errorCodes.test(sc) && ! ignoreErrors) {
1991            throw new RestCallException(response, null, "HTTP method ''{0}'' call to ''{1}'' caused response code ''{2}, {3}''.\nResponse: \n{4}",
1992               method, getURI(), sc, response.getReasonPhrase(), response.getContent().asAbbreviatedString(1000));
1993         }
1994
1995      } catch (RuntimeException | RestCallException e) {
1996         if (response != null)
1997            response.close();
1998         throw e;
1999      } catch (Throwable e) {
2000         if (response != null)
2001            response.close();
2002         throw new RestCallException(response, e, "Call failed.");
2003      }
2004
2005      return this.response;
2006   }
2007
2008   /**
2009    * Same as {@link #run()} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
2010    *
2011    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2012    * <p class='bjava'>
2013    *    Future&lt;RestResponse&gt; <jv>future</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).runFuture();
2014    *
2015    *    <jc>// Do some other stuff</jc>
2016    *
2017    *    <jk>try</jk> {
2018    *       String <jv>body</jv> = <jv>future</jv>.get().getContent().asString();
2019    *       <jc>// Succeeded!</jc>
2020    *    } <jk>catch</jk> (RestCallException <jv>e</jv>) {
2021    *       <jc>// Failed!</jc>
2022    *    }
2023    * </p>
2024    *
2025    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
2026    *    <li class='note'>Use the {@link RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean)} method to customize the
2027    *       executor service used for creating {@link Future Futures}.
2028    * </ul>
2029    *
2030    * @return The HTTP status code.
2031    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
2032    */
2033    public Future<RestResponse> runFuture() throws RestCallException {
2034        return client.getExecutorService().submit(this::run);
2035    }
2036
2037   /**
2038    * Same as {@link #run()} but immediately calls {@link RestResponse#consume()} to clean up the response.
2039    *
2040    * <p>
2041    * Use this method if you're only interested in the status line of the response and not the response entity.
2042    * Attempts to call any of the methods on the response object that retrieve the body (e.g. {@link ResponseContent#asReader()}
2043    * will cause a {@link RestCallException} to be thrown.
2044    *
2045    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
2046    *    <li class='note'>You do not need to execute {@link InputStream#close()} on the response body to consume the response.
2047    * </ul>
2048    *
2049    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2050    * <p class='bjava'>
2051    *  <jc>// Get the response code.
2052    *  // No need to call close() on the RestResponse object.</jc>
2053    *  <jk>int</jk> <jv>rc</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).complete().getResponseCode();
2054    * </p>
2055    *
2056    * @return The response object.
2057    * @throws RestCallException If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
2058    */
2059   public RestResponse complete() throws RestCallException {
2060      return run().consume();
2061   }
2062
2063   /**
2064    * Same as {@link #complete()} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
2065    *
2066    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2067    * <p class='bjava'>
2068    *    Future&lt;RestResponse&gt; <jv>future</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).completeFuture();
2069    *
2070    *    <jc>// Do some other stuff</jc>
2071    *
2072    *    <jk>int</jk> <jv>rc</jv> = <jv>future</jv>.get().getResponseStatus();
2073    * </p>
2074    *
2075    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
2076    *    <li class='note'>Use the {@link RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean)} method to customize the
2077    *       executor service used for creating {@link Future Futures}.
2078    *    <li class='note'>You do not need to execute {@link InputStream#close()} on the response body to consume the response.
2079    * </ul>
2080    *
2081    * @return The HTTP status code.
2082    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
2083    */
2084   public Future<RestResponse> completeFuture() throws RestCallException {
2085      return client.getExecutorService().submit(
2086         this::complete
2087      );
2088   }
2089
2090   /**
2091    * A shortcut for calling <c>run().getContent().asString()</c>.
2092    *
2093    * @return The response content as a simple string.
2094    * @throws RestCallException If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
2095    */
2096   public String getResponseAsString() throws RestCallException {
2097      return run().getContent().asString();
2098   }
2099
2100   /**
2101    * A shortcut for calling <c>run().getContent().as(<js>type</js>)</c>.
2102    *
2103    * @param type The object type to create.
2104    * @param <T> The object type to create.
2105    * @see ResponseContent#as(Class)
2106    * @return The response content as a simple string.
2107    * @throws RestCallException If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
2108    */
2109   public <T> T getResponse(Class<T> type) throws RestCallException {
2110      return run().getContent().as(type);
2111   }
2112
2113   /**
2114    * A shortcut for calling <c>run().getContent().as(<js>type</js>,<js>args</js>)</c>.
2115    *
2116    * @param <T>
2117    *    The object type to create.
2118    * @param type
2119    *    The object type to create.
2120    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
2121    * @param args
2122    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
2123    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
2124    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
2125    * @see ResponseContent#as(Type,Type...)
2126    * @return The response content as a simple string.
2127    * @throws RestCallException If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
2128    */
2129   public <T> T getResponse(Type type, Type...args) throws RestCallException {
2130      return run().getContent().as(type, args);
2131   }

2148      return hasHttpEntity() ? ((HttpEntityEnclosingRequestBase)request).getEntity() : null;
2149   }

2248    * </ul>
2249    *
2250    * @return The original request URI.
2251    */

2257   /**
2258    * Aborts this http request. Any active execution of this method should return immediately.
2259    *
2260    * If the request has not started, it will abort after the next execution.
2261    * <br>Aborting this request will cause all subsequent executions with this request to fail.
2262    */
2263   @Override /* HttpUriRequest */
2264   public void abort() throws UnsupportedOperationException {
2265      request.abort();

2293   /**
2294    * Checks if a certain header is present in this message.
2295    *
2296    * Header values are ignored.
2297    *
2298    * @param name The header name to check for.
2299    * @return <jk>true</jk> if at least one header with this name is present.
2300    */
2301   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2302   public boolean containsHeader(String name) {
2303      return headerData.contains(name);
2304   }
2305
2306   /**
2307    * Returns all the headers with a specified name of this message.
2308    *
2309    * Header values are ignored.
2310    * <br>Headers are ordered in the sequence they will be sent over a connection.
2311    *
2312    * @param name The name of the headers to return.
2313    * @return The headers whose name property equals name.
2314    */
2315   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2316   public Header[] getHeaders(String name) {
2317      return headerData.getAll(name);
2318   }
2319
2320   /**
2321    * Returns the first header with a specified name of this message.
2322    *
2323    * Header values are ignored.
2324    * <br>If there is more than one matching header in the message the first element of {@link #getHeaders(String)} is returned.
2325    * <br>If there is no matching header in the message <jk>null</jk> is returned.
2326    *
2327    * @param name The name of the header to return.
2328    * @return The first header whose name property equals name or <jk>null</jk> if no such header could be found.
2329    */
2330   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2331   public Header getFirstHeader(String name) {
2332      return headerData.getFirst(name).orElse(null);
2333   }
2334
2335   /**
2336    * Returns the last header with a specified name of this message.
2337    *
2338    * Header values are ignored.
2339    * <br>If there is more than one matching header in the message the last element of {@link #getHeaders(String)} is returned.
2340    * <br>If there is no matching header in the message null is returned.
2341    *
2342    * @param name The name of the header to return.
2343    * @return The last header whose name property equals name or <jk>null</jk> if no such header could be found.
2344    */
2345   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2346   public Header getLastHeader(String name) {
2347      return headerData.getLast(name).orElse(null);
2348   }
2349
2350   /**
2351    * Returns all the headers of this message.
2352    *
2353    * Headers are ordered in the sequence they will be sent over a connection.
2354    *
2355    * @return All the headers of this message
2356    */
2357   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2358   public Header[] getAllHeaders() {
2359      return headerData.getAll();
2360   }
2361
2362   /**
2363    * Adds a header to this message.
2364    *
2365    * The header will be appended to the end of the list.
2366    *
2367    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
2368    *    <li class='note'>{@link #header(Header)} is an equivalent method and the preferred method for fluent-style coding.
2369    * </ul>
2370    *
2371    * @param header The header to append.
2372    */
2373   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2374   public void addHeader(Header header) {
2375      headerData.append(header);
2376   }
2377
2378   /**
2379    * Adds a header to this message.
2380    *
2381    * The header will be appended to the end of the list.
2382    *
2383    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
2384    *    <li class='note'>{@link #header(String,Object)} is an equivalent method and the preferred method for fluent-style coding.
2385    * </ul>
2386    *
2387    * @param name The name of the header.
2388    * @param value The value of the header.
2389    */
2390   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2391   public void addHeader(String name, String value) {
2392      headerData.append(stringHeader(name, value));
2393   }

2399    *
2400    * @param header The header to set.
2401    */
2402   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2403   public void setHeader(Header header) {
2404      headerData.set(header);
2405   }

2418   }

2505   // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2506   // Utility methods
2507   // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2508
2509   private ContentType getRequestContentType(ContentType def) {
2510      Header h = request.getFirstHeader("Content-Type");
2511      if (h != null) {
2512         String s = h.getValue();
2513         if (! isEmpty(s))
2514            return ContentType.of(s);
2515      }
2516      return def;
2517   }
2518
2519   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
2520   private static Map<Object,Object> toMap(Object o) {
2521      return (Map<Object,Object>)o;
2522   }
2523
2524   /**
2525    * Creates a new header.
2526    *
2527    * @param name The header name.
2528    * @param value The header value.
2529    * @param serializer The part serializer to use, or <jk>null</jk> to use the part serializer defined on the client.
2530    * @param schema Optional HTTP part schema to provide to the part serializer.
2531    * @param skipIfEmpty If <jk>true</jk>, empty string values will be ignored on the request.
2532    * @return A new header.
2533    */
2534   protected Header createHeader(String name, Object value, HttpPartSerializer serializer, HttpPartSchema schema, Boolean skipIfEmpty) {
2535      if (isEmpty(name))
2536         return null;
2537      if (skipIfEmpty == null)
2538         skipIfEmpty = client.isSkipEmptyHeaderData();
2539      if (serializer == null)
2540         serializer = client.getPartSerializer();
2541      return new SerializedHeader(name, value, getPartSerializerSession(serializer), schema, skipIfEmpty);
2542   }
2543
2544   private Header createHeader(String name, Object value) {
2545      return createHeader(name, value, null, null, null);
2546   }
2547
2548   /**
2549    * Creates a new query/form-data/path part.
2550    *
2551    * @param name The part name.
2552    * @param value The part value.
2553    * @param type The HTTP part type.
2554    * @param serializer The part serializer to use, or <jk>null</jk> to use the part serializer defined on the client.
2555    * @param schema Optional HTTP part schema to provide to the part serializer.
2556    * @param skipIfEmpty If <jk>true</jk>, empty string values will be ignored on the request.
2557    * @return A new part.
2558    */
2559   protected NameValuePair createPart(String name, Object value, HttpPartType type, HttpPartSerializer serializer, HttpPartSchema schema, Boolean skipIfEmpty) {
2560      if (isEmpty(name))
2561         return null;
2562      if (skipIfEmpty == null) {
2563         if (type == QUERY)
2564            skipIfEmpty = client.isSkipEmptyQueryData();
2565         else if (type == FORMDATA)
2566            skipIfEmpty = client.isSkipEmptyFormData();
2567         else
2568            skipIfEmpty = false;
2569      }
2570      if (serializer == null)
2571         serializer = client.getPartSerializer();
2572      return new SerializedPart(name, value, type, getPartSerializerSession(serializer), schema, skipIfEmpty);
2573   }
2574
2575   private NameValuePair createPart(HttpPartType type, String name, Object value) {
2576      return createPart(name, value, type, null, null, null);
2577   }
2578
2579   private HttpPartSerializerSession getPartSerializerSession(HttpPartSerializer serializer) {
2580      if (serializer == null)
2581         serializer = client.getPartSerializer();
2582      HttpPartSerializerSession s = partSerializerSessions.get(serializer);
2583      if (s == null) {
2584         s = serializer.getPartSession();
2585         partSerializerSessions.put(serializer, s);
2586      }
2587      return s;
2588   }
2589
2590   HttpPartSerializerSession getPartSerializerSession() {
2591      if (partSerializerSession == null)
2592         partSerializerSession = getPartSerializerSession(null);
2593      return partSerializerSession;
2594   }
2595
2596   private static boolean isNameValuePairArray(Object o) {
2597      if (! isArray(o))
2598         return false;
2599      if (NameValuePair.class.isAssignableFrom(o.getClass().getComponentType()))
2600         return true;
2601      return false;
2602   }
2603
2604   private static boolean isHeaderArray(Object o) {
2605      if (! isArray(o))
2606         return false;
2607      if (Header.class.isAssignableFrom(o.getClass().getComponentType()))
2608         return true;
2609      return false;
2610   }
2611
2612   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2613   // Simple parts
2614   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2615
2616   private class SimplePart implements NameValuePair {
2617      final String name;
2618      final String value;
2619
2620      SimplePart(NameValuePair x, boolean skipIfEmpty) {
2621         name = x.getName();
2622         if (x instanceof SerializedHeader) {
2623            value = ((SerializedHeader)x).copyWith(getPartSerializerSession(), null).getValue();
2624         } else if (x instanceof SerializedPart) {
2625            value = ((SerializedPart)x).copyWith(getPartSerializerSession(), null).getValue();
2626         } else {
2627            String v = x.getValue();
2628            value = (isEmpty(v) && skipIfEmpty) ? null : v;
2629         }
2630      }
2631
2632      boolean isValid() {
2633         if (isEmpty(name) || value == null)
2634            return false;
2635         return true;
2636      }
2637
2638      @Override
2639      public String getName() {
2640         return name;
2641      }
2642
2643      @Override
2644      public String getValue() {
2645         return value;
2646      }
2647   }
2648
2649   private class SimpleQuery extends SimplePart {
2650      SimpleQuery(NameValuePair x) {
2651         super(x, client.isSkipEmptyQueryData());
2652      }
2653   }
2654
2655   private class SimpleFormData extends SimplePart {
2656      SimpleFormData(NameValuePair x) {
2657         super(x, client.isSkipEmptyFormData());
2658      }
2659   }
2660
2661   private class SimplePath extends SimplePart {
2662      SimplePath(NameValuePair x) {
2663         super(x, false);
2664      }
2665   }
2666
2667   private class SimpleHeader extends SimplePart implements Header {
2668
2669      SimpleHeader(NameValuePair x) {
2670         super(x, client.isSkipEmptyHeaderData());
2671      }
2672
2673      @Override
2674      public HeaderElement[] getElements() throws ParseException {
2675         return null;
2676      }
2677   }

2691   @Override
2692   public void close() throws Exception {
2693      complete();
2694   }
2695
2696   @Override /* ContextSession */
2697   protected JsonMap properties() {
2698      return filteredMap()
2699         .append("client", client.properties())
2700         .append("ignoreErrors", ignoreErrors)
2701         .append("interceptors", interceptors)
2702         .append("requestBodySchema", contentSchema)
2703         .append("response", response)
2704         .append("serializer", serializer);
2705   }
